subject: Re: [junit] Problems with assertEquals...
msgSnippet: ... Why can t Java have a /real/ Date class?!!? -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603 Let s write
messageBody:
Lewis, Grant wrote:

> It was the stupid milliseconds. I called toString() to compare the date
> strings instead of comparing the objects. The database load caused a
> millisecond mismatch with the original that was saved.

Why can't Java have a /real/ "Date" class?!!?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
